page.title: 19POLLUTION IN SAND BAY
page.content: Sand Bay is almost a natural dustbin for the rubbish of The Bristol Channel.Over the years whales, dolphins,cows,sheep and many other animals have been left behind by the tide.Added to this has been all the refuse that has found its way into the sea either from ship or shore. 1985 has seen the problem receive extended coverage on television,local radio and in the newspapers.The appeals from local residents for a "clean up"has brought some action.The efforts of small voluntary groups to clean parts of the beach helped to persuade the council of the urgency. Woodspring Council finally gave Kewstoke Parish Council the help it had requested for years;the beach at Sand Bay now has a more regular clean up.
